-1.title: Episode dated 18 May 2016
-1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Villari's
1.plot: Robert tries to put Villari's in Palmyra, NJ, back on the path to success.

2.title: Mainelli's
2.plot: Robert heads to Providence, Rhode Island, to help the owners of "Mainelli's", a failing Italian eatery that's plagued by bad service, food-safety issues and an unskilled kitchen staff.

3.title: Rascal's BBQ & Crab House
3.plot: Rascal's BBQ and Crab House, a struggling seafood joint in New Castle, Delaware, has one of the dirtiest kitchens Robert ever has seen.

4.title: Salt Works II
4.plot: Robert visits "Salt Works II" in Wilmington, North Carolina. He finds that they rely too heavily on canned food, so he updates the menu and modernizes the interior.

5.title: Meglio's
5.plot: Robert finds an Italian restaurant, in Bridgeton, Missouri, stuck in the past with lots of problems.

6.title: Secret Garden
6.plot: Down in Jacksonville, Fla., Robert strives to save "The Secret Garden Café", by giving it a new menu and updated decor.

7.title: Flood Tide
7.plot: Robert must overcome the impossible to save the Flood Tide Restaurant.

1.title: Dodge City
1.plot: Robert heads to Harrisburg, PA, in an effort to save Dodge City USA.

2.title: La Stanza
2.plot: An old-world Italian restaurant is being ruined by the owner's daughter.

3.title: Sweet Tea
3.plot: The Sweet Tea restaurant is being run into the ground by its new owners.

4.title: County Fare
4.plot: The downtrodden diner County Fare is now on the verge of bankruptcy.

5.title: Snooty Fox
5.plot: Robert races to Indianapolis, Indiana, to help save the Snooty Fox.

6.title: Pastori's
6.plot: Robert takes his skills and knowledge to the Nutmeg State of Connecticut.

7.title: Scrimmages
7.plot: The phrase 'there is no I in team' truly applies at Scrimmages restaurant.

8.title: Mamma D's
8.plot: Mamma D's is part restaurant, part vineyard and mostly petting zoo.

9.title: Off Street Cafe
9.plot: Robert hopes to turn around the gloomy extended-family Off Street Cafe.

10.title: The Trails
10.plot: Robert hits the trail to San Diego, CA where he finds The Trails Eatery. An adorable little café owned and run by a young, energetic woman named Stacey. While, the surface here looks great, underneath the nicely painted exterior, is a business spiraling into bankruptcy. Will Stacey take Robert's advice or will it be the end of the line for The Trails?

11.title: Cap'n and the Cowboy
11.plot: Chef Robert finds himself walking into a salty sea dog's worst nightmare.

12.title: Mad Cactus
12.plot: Robert finds himself in a prickly situation in Strongsville, OH.

13.title: Wildcat Cafe
13.plot: It's back to school for Robert as he travels to Canton South High School.

14.title: McShane's
14.plot: Robert thought he'd seen the most rundown eateries; then he saw McShane's.

15.title: Coffee's Boilin' Pot
15.plot: Chef Robert Irvine is boiling mad when he arrives at Coffee's Boilin' Pot.

16.title: St. James Soup Kitchen
16.plot: Chef Robert tackles his biggest challenge to date, St. James Soup Kitchen.

17.title: Sullivan's Grill
17.plot: Robert heads to Colorado to help a young widow and her failing restaurant.

18.title: Hoffman's Bistro
18.plot: Hoffman's Bistro and Patisserie's intervention couldn't come soon enough.

1.title: Moss' Prime Rib & Spaghetti House
1.plot: Chef Robert Irvine kicks off Season 3 of Restaurant: Impossible at Moss' Prime Rib and Spaghetti House, in Elyria, OH, in what may be the most intense show to date.

2.title: Chatterbox
2.plot: This two-year-old outwardly nice restaurant is confusing: it's clean, cute and cozy, yet it's on the brink of failure. Why? Well, it doesn't take long to get to the root of the problem.

3.title: Anna Maria's
3.plot: Chef Robert Irvine has seen many dirty and neglected restaurants, but none has made him physically ill like Anna Maria's, in Dunmore, PA. The Italian eatery's glory days, and last apparent cleaning, were 25 years ago.

4.title: Del's
4.plot: When Chef Robert Irvine visits Del's, in Pittsburgh, PA, it's clear that the biggest issue with this failing 62-year-old icon is not the food or decor but owner Marianne.

5.title: Woody's Tupelo Steakhouse
5.plot: When Chef Robert Irvine first sees Woody's Tupelo Steakhouse in Tupelo, MS, it's clear why they are drowning in debt. The dining room is a dusty, dark cave, and the horrible tableside service is worse than the mediocre food.

6.title: Valley View
6.plot: This diner located in Amish country is suffering from an outdated decor and menu, as well as structural issues. But Chef Robert Irvine's biggest challenge to turn this business around will be in changing the family roles.

7.title: Pelican Grill
7.plot: In only two days, and with only $10,000, Chef Robert needs to overhaul not only the uninspired, cluttered interior but also the lack of leadership and structure at the center of the restaurant's problems.

8.title: Mama Lee's
8.plot: in San Antonio, TX, Chef Robert Irvine is tasked with turning around Mama Lee's Soul Food Restaurant, a four-year-old eatery that has never turned a profit and is only weeks away from closing.

9.title: Pappas Restaurant
9.plot: Chef Robert Irvine's latest mission takes him to Benicia, California, and Pappas Restaurant, a family-owned Greek restaurant on the brink of extinction.

10.title: Ristorante Barolo
10.plot: After a very successful first five years, a changing economy combined with the high cost of maintaining a historic building plus family health problems have hurt Ristorante Barolo.

11.title: University Grill
11.plot: Chef Robert heads to Burlington, NC, in an attempt to save the University Grill. The establishment was opened by siblings Eleni, George and Manny to help provide for their parents during retirement, but it's now facing failure.

12.title: Pollard's Bar-B-Que
12.plot: Robert visits Memphis to save a failing barbecue restaurant. After eking out a living at a small takeout operation for 16 years, Tarrance Pollard decided the only way to grow his business was to move up to an eat-in restaurant.

13.title: White House Edition
13.plot: The First Lady asks Robert to create a dining room, renovate the kitchen and create a community garden to provide a healthy, vegetable-fueled meal for the kids of Horton's Kids to enjoy.

0.title: Wedding Impossible
0.plot: Chef Robert Irvine plans his own Napa Valley, California wedding to pro wrestler Gail Kim.

1.title: Longbranch Steak and Seafood
1.plot: Chef Robert Irvine heads to the small town of Fayetteville, GA.

2.title: The Main Dish
2.plot: Lynn & Ken, bought The Main Dish years ago and it's been a pain ever since.

3.title: Zandi's Grill
3.plot: Chef Robert Irvine visit Zandi's Grill in Millersville, Maryland, and finds lackluster food, outdated décor and sister owners who have lost their passion for the restaurant.

4.title: Italian Village
4.plot: Chef Robert's latest mission takes him to the Philadelphia suburbs.

5.title: Stella's Italian Restaurant
5.plot: Chef Robert Irvine is on the move... this time to Stratford, Connecticut.

6.title: Gusanoz Mexican Restaurant
6.plot: Chef Robert Irvine heads to the small town of Lebanon, New Hampshire.

7.title: Frankie's
7.plot: Chef Robert is heading to Three Rivers, Michigan.

8.title: Paliani's Restaurant
8.plot: Chef Robert Irvine travels to Burton, Michigan.

9.title: Michele's
9.plot: Robert Irvine faces one of his biggest challenges yet.

10.title: Maple Tree Café
10.plot: Chef Robert Irvine heads to Las Vegas.

11.title: Behind the Impossible
11.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

12.title: Whistle Stop
12.plot: Robert's latest mission takes him to the Whistle Stop in Hot Springs, Ark.,

13.title: Valley Inn
13.plot: Robert is in Palos Hills, Ill., to help save the Valley Inn restaurant.

14.title: Oleander Bar and Grill
14.plot: Robert heads to Olean, NY to meet the owners of the Oleander Bar and Grill.

0.title: Holiday: Impossible
0.plot: On his biggest mission yet, Robert Irvine heads to the Jersey Shore to renew two places devastated by Hurricane Sandy. He works to restore the LBI Pancake House and give the Ship Bottom Fire Company a much deserved "thank you."

1.title: Poco's on the Boulevard
1.plot: Chef Robert Irvine is heading to Kansas City, Mo., to save a once flourishing family restaurant and repair the relationship between two sisters. Poco's on the Boulevard once served delicious, authentic Latin food, but since the death of chef/owner Poco, her daughters Claudia and Dana have been struggling to maintain the restaurant's food quality and profits.

2.title: Rohrer's Tavern
2.plot: Robert Irvine heads to North Bend, Ohio, to help revive Rohrer's Tavern.

3.title: Bronk's Bar and Grill
3.plot: Husband and wife get help, from Robert Irvine, to save their struggling business, "Bronk's Bar and Grill", in Lake City, Minnesota. Problems include an untrained staff; a kitchen stocked with frozen food; and a generic-looking dining room.

4.title: Rising Sun Bistro
4.plot: The French-themed Rising Sun Bistro in Kalispell, Mont., is facing a mountain of problems: A chaotic kitchen, an uninspired decor, $500,000 worth of debt, and owners who can't stand looking at each other. Chef Robert Irvine has two days and $10,000 to get the restaurant, and the owners, on the right track.

5.title: Whiskey Creek Steakhouse
5.plot: After 20 years in business, the Ziarinks, owners of a steakhouse in Keyport, Wash., ask for help improving poorly-cooked food and drab décor. Also: Robert confronts a member of the staff about missing money.

6.title: Windseeker Restaurant
6.plot: Robert Irvine has only two days to help the Windseeker Restaurant.

7.title: Sapori D'Italia
7.plot: Robert Irvine must fix a broken family in order to fix their restaurant in Fountain Hills, Arizona.

8.title: Nanny Goats Cafe and Feed Bin
8.plot: Robert's mission is to save the failing Nanny Goats Cafe and Feed Bin.

9.title: Dinner Bell Restaurant
9.plot: Chef Robert Irvine is in Madison, Tenn., to help owner, Tommy, keep the doors of the Dinner Bell Restaurant open. And Robert is just in time, as Tommy's only two days from having to close the doors on his four-year-old business for good. Robert and his team must clean the restaurant, freshen the menu and fix the staff's bad habits in two days, before Tommy loses everything.

10.title: Maniaci's Italian Bistro
10.plot: Maniaci's Italian Bistro was thriving, but the new owners are killing it.

11.title: Caseyville Cafe
11.plot: Robert Irvine can see why the Caseyville Cafe in Illinois is failing.

12.title: Soup to Nuts Diner
12.plot: The "Soup to Nuts Diner", in Tavares, Florida, is a 1950s-theme diner that needs Robert Irvine's help.

13.title: Sweet Tea's Restaurant and Catering
13.plot: Robert Irvine tries to save "Sweet Tea's Restaurant and Catering" in Pineville, N.C.

1.title: Something's Fishy
1.plot: Chef Robert Irvine travels to Fishkill, N.Y., to help Joe and Dena save their floundering restaurant, Joe Willy's Seafood House. While experienced in purchasing seafood, Joe's skills as a head cook leave a lot to be desired. And the stress of the failing business is taking its toll on Dena and their three kids. Robert must force Joe to get past his pride in order to save his restaurant - and his family.

2.title: Father Knows Worst
2.plot: Robert Irvine goes to Murrells Inlet, S.C., to save "Old World Italian Restaurant".

3.title: Creepy in Clearwater
3.plot: Smitty's Restaurant in Clearwater, Fla., has problems. Lots of them.

5.title: Drowning in Debt
5.plot: Robert has faced many stubborn owners before, but he may have met his match with the owner of "Mom and Dad's Italian Restaurant" in DeFuniak Springs, Florida.

6.title: Muskrat Mayhem
6.plot: Robert helps three generations of women to save the "Wagon Wheel Family Restaurant" in Smyrna, Delaware. The only thing keeping this restaurant alive, right now, is muskrat.

7.title: In the Pits
7.plot: An over-saturated market and a staff of misfits put "Bryan's Smokehouse", in Lufkin, Texas, into debt.

9.title: Lost in the Woods
9.plot: Pinehurst Country Lodge in Greely, PA.

10.title: Sink or Swim
10.plot: Pier West Restaurant in Twin Lakes, Wisconsin.

11.title: It's All Greek to Me
11.plot: Angelo's Family Restaurant in Woodstock, Illinois.

14.title: Kalico Kraziness
14.plot: Chef Robert Irvine travels to Douglas, MI to repair the Kalico Kitchen.

15.title: Barely Edible
15.plot: Edibles Restaurant & Pub in Horsham, PA.

16.title: Good Food, Bad Vices
16.plot: Benner Street Restaurant and Bar in Bethlehem, PA.

17.title: Pie in the Sky
17.plot: Improvements to Aponte's Pizzeria in Mason, OH.

1.title: Bring Mama Back
1.plot: Chef Robert Irvine has just two days to address trust issues, frozen food in the kitchen and finances that aren't adding up, if there's any chance of restoring this restaurant, "Mama Campisi's Restaurant" in St. Louis, to its former glory.

2.title: Feathers Fly
2.plot: Robert ruffles quite a few feathers when he heads to Kokomo, Indiana to help the Duncan family save their 33-year-old "Ducky's Family Restaurant". Robert's assessment of the terrible food and dysfunctional management was hard to hear.

3.title: His Way or the Highway
3.plot: The Windsor 75 in Windsor, CT, is just 7 years old, but is plagued with problems. George's family is fed up with the restaurant and his stubborn ways. Can Robert Irvine pull the restaurant into the 21st century?

4.title: Outside the Box
4.plot: Robert Irvine's baffled after arriving at the Coach Lamp Restaurant and Pub in Louisville. The restaurant, the food and the owners are all great, so why is it failing? Robert sifts through things to discover why.

5.title: Soul Searching
5.plot: Robert Irvine travels to Hagerstown to save the Georgia Boy Cafe. The stress of the restaurant is ruining the once loving relationship between the owners, who avoid each other to keep from screaming in front of the guests.

6.title: Unlucky Number Seven
6.plot: If SEVEN doesn't get a complete overhaul - from the owners, down to the food - it will never be more than a zero.

7.title: Unfixable Family
7.plot: Chef Robert Irvine may have met his match when he encounters the volatile owners of Mike LaSusa's Italian Restaurant in Oak Creek, Wisconsin.

8.title: Holiday: Impossible 2
8.plot: On his biggest mission yet, Robert Irvine heads to the Jersey Shore to renew two places devastated by Hurricane Sandy. He works to restore the LBI Pancake House and give the Ship Bottom Fire Company a much deserved "thank you."

9.title: Goombazz Gone Wild
9.plot: Sal and Brenda's one-year old restaurant, Goombazz Big City Eatzz, has struggled to find a strong customer base and is now more than $300,000 in debt.

10.title: Clueless in the Country
10.plot: Robert offers advice to former stay-at-home mom/owner of Heather's Country Kitchen in Plains, Montana.

11.title: Monkey Business
11.plot: Robert helps the owner of the "Spunky Monkey Bar and Grill" in Auburn, Washington.

12.title: Dirty Laundry
12.plot: Robert Irvine heads to Hillbillies Restaurant in Murphys, California, to investigate why Jami's breakfast and lunch spot is failing. While the name promises backwoods charm, Robert finds nothing charming about a decor.

13.title: Mumbo Jumbo
13.plot: The owners of "Estrada's Restaurant" in San Francisco are $400,000 in debt and are lacking in passion for the food.

1.title: Up in Smoke
1.plot: Robert deems the barbecue bland and the management inefficient when he arrives at the "Mill Creek BBQ" in Redlands, Cal., which also finds him helping to repair the owner's relationship with her 21-year-old daughter.

2.title: A Lot to Lose
2.plot: Bland food, poor service and no lunch crowd are among the problems identified by Robert, when he arrives at "Tootie's Texas Barbecue" in Cathedral City, Cal., which is owned by a woman who recently battled cancer.

3.title: Fiery Family Fusion
3.plot: A couple who have spent two years trying to make Pasion Latin Fusion Restaurant, in Albuquerque, N.M., a success ask for help from Robert Irvine, who determines that tension between the owner's wife and brother is bad for business.

4.title: Pizza: Impossible
4.plot: A New York-style pizzeria, in Baton Rouge, Louisiana, serves great food but the business struggles because of a stubborn owner who is scaring away customers with his "my way or the highway" attitude.

5.title: Ungratifying
5.plot: Robert Irvine is in Houston to turn around the Gratifi Kitchen and Bar. In addition to a kitchen so filthy that Robert shuts it down just minutes into his visit, Kevin's poor attitude is a cause of tension for the employees.

6.title: Face the Music
6.plot: Robert tries to help "Urban Roots", a restaurant and entertainment venue in Oklahoma City, become a success, but first he has to reignite the owner/chef's passion for cooking and light a fire under the lackadaisical staff.

7.title: Treading Water
7.plot: Robert offers advice to a seemingly passionless businesswoman who's finding it difficult to keep "Bryant's Seafood World" in Hueytown, Alabama, afloat after taking over the hometown favorite four years ago.

8.title: Bummed Out
8.plot: High emotions and yelling mark Robert's trip to "Bumbino's Italian Ristorante" in Orange County, Florida, where he deals with crumbling relationships, the firing of staff and a switch made in the kitchen.

9.title: Meet the Impossible
9.plot: Chef Robert Irvine celebrates the show's 100th episode by offering a glimpse at what goes on behind the scenes. Included: interviews with the people who make the makeovers possible; and a look back at the dirtiest kitchens.

10.title: Living in the Dark Ages
10.plot: A BBQ restaurant, with a caveman/dinosaur theme, needs to be saved from extinction in Winter Garden, Fla. On Robert's to-do list is an overhaul of the décor, consisting of inflatables & foam rocks; & offer tips to control the kitchen chaos.

11.title: The Writing on the Wall
11.plot: Robert helps the owner and operator of a successful sawmill turn "Big Jim's Bama Q" in Hammondville, Ala., into a barbecue destination, but first he has to teach him a thing or two about what it takes to thrive in the food business.

12.title: Saving Grace
12.plot: A business and marriage are in trouble when Robert arrives at "Grace's Place Bagels and Deli", in Palm Coast, Florida, which is owned by a couple who are $320,000 in debt and are failing because of a lack of communication and teamwork.

13.title: No Day at the Beach
13.plot: The Portu-Greek Café in Hudson, Florida, proves to be a challenge for Robert, who has to teach the self-described stubborn owner and his bickering family how to cooperate.

1.title: Fork in the Road
1.plot: A friendship is falling apart over the struggles of the 3-year-old "Fork Diner" in Calhoun, Georgia, which chef Robert Irvine deems unsuccessful because of boring food, a lack of cleanliness and a staff that's disinterested.

2.title: Culture Clash
2.plot: An Atlanta restaurant has the false reputation of being strictly for Muslims, which is keeping potential customers away. Another challenge Robert faces is the owner, whose experience in catering isn't translating into running this business.

3.title: Bowling: Impossible
3.plot: "Paul's Bar and Bowling" in Paterson, N.J., a family-owned neighborhood staple since 1929, needs help getting out of an 8-year stump. To succeed, Robert takes the business into the 21st century, beginning with a total design overhaul.

4.title: Golf: Impossible
4.plot: Robert arrives at the "Pomona Golf and Country Club" in Egg Harbor City, N.J., a 9-hole golf course and clubhouse run by three cousins, and is tasked with coming up with a business plan for the financially and emotionally strained owners.

5.title: Holy Cow!
5.plot: The divorced owners of the "Country Cow Restaurant and Bar" in Campton, N.H., are on their best behavior for Robert's visit, but the staff and behind-the-scenes footage reveal that animosity between the couple is a problem.

6.title: No Laughing Matter
6.plot: Robert deals with an owner who fancies himself a stand-up comedian and is more focused on telling jokes to customers than paying attention to the quality of food he's serving at "Uncle Andy's Diner" in Portland, Maine.

7.title: Take It or Leave It
7.plot: Robert offers to buy "El Bistro" in Titusville, Pa., after the owner, a single mother of four with a love of cooking, asks for help turning around her failing restaurant.

8.title: Spicing Things Up
8.plot: Robert deals with clueless owners, a scantily-clad wait staff and $300,000 in debt, when he arrives at "Spicy Bar and Grill" in Fall Church, Virginia. Also: a new chef needs to be hired.

9.title: Military: Impossible
9.plot: Robert travels to Fort Bragg, N.C., on a mission to breath new life into the Green Beret Club, one of the only full-service restaurants on the post.

10.title: Drama at Mamma's
10.plot: Robert deals with feuding sisters at "Mamma Lucrezia's" in Bellefonte, Pa., which despite excellent food coming from the kitchen, is losing $1000s a month and faces competition from a nearby Italian restaurant, owned by their brother.

11.title: Paradise: Impossible
11.plot: Robert Irvine is in South Padre Island to help the Padre Rita Grill. The grill has both food and music, but they're not doing either very well. Robert must overhaul the tacky decor and get the owners focused on the bottom line.

12.title: An Abundance of Emotions
12.plot: Robert offers help to the owner of "Abudanza Restaurant" in Wilbraham, Mass., a proud man with years of executive chef experience, but who is burnt out from the demands of the job and caring for a sick child.

13.title: Recipe for Disaster
13.plot: On this episode of Restaurant: Impossible, Robert encounters the mother lode of disaster and, potentially, the most explosive family yet.

14.title: Worst of the Worst
14.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Without a Prayer
1.plot: "Mama E's Wings and Waffles" in Oklahoma City, a once-thriving restaurant that was featured on Diners, Drive-ins and Dives (2006), is in financial trouble after a failed attempt at opening a second location.

2.title: Oh Brother!
2.plot: Parents, who are financial backers of the "Knife and Fork Gastropub" in San Antonio, call for Robert Irvine's help, because the restaurant, which is run by their sons, is losing money despite its seeming success.

3.title: Revved Up
3.plot: Restaurant: Impossible goes hog wild in Albuquerque, NM, at the Shade Tree Customs and Cafe along Route 66 where Robert Irvine meets a handful of characters who opened a full service restaurant above their motorcycle repair shop.

4.title: Mystic Mystery
4.plot: Robert starts from scratch, with the owners of "Mystic Treats", in Ashland, Oregon, who have struggled for three years to attract customers with their vegetarian and offbeat pizzas.

5.title: Betting the House
5.plot: Robert walks into a desperate situation, when he takes on the makeover of "Zoogs Caveman Cookin" in Port Hadlock, Wash., which, at just two years old, is dirty and being run by the owner's inexperienced daughter.

6.title: Dog and Pony Show
6.plot: Robert encounters a vocal group of customers, when he arrives at the "Dog and Pony Ale House" in Renton, Washington, where he tries to help the owner toughen up and works to resolve trust issues with her staff.

7.title: Game Over
7.plot: Hurt feelings between brothers, a controlling mother, and a noisy arcade are among the challenges facing Robert, when he travels to Omaha, Nebraska, to help the struggling "Bene Pizza and Pasta".

1.title: 4,000 Square Feet of Trouble
1.plot: A 4000-square-foot restaurant/music venue poses a supersized challenge for Robert, as he tries to help the dispirited owner of the 8-year-old "WhaBah Steakhouse" in Bowling Green, Kentucky, avoid bankruptcy.

2.title: Double Trouble
2.plot: Robert is asked to save two Italian restaurants, owned by one family, in Summerville, S.C.

3.title: Chocolate: Impossible
3.plot: A French bistro with an event space and chocolate boutique in Calvert, Texas, is in big debt, partly because the stubborn owner refuses to advertise or cater to the local community, which is why his daughter has called Robert for help.

4.title: When Life Gives You Lemons ...
4.plot: Robert takes on a two-in-one challenge, when he travels to Downers Grove, Illinois, to fix a grocery store with a full-service bistro, owned by two best friends who are failing at both sides of the business, causing their relationship to deteriorate as well.

5.title: Prescription for Failure
5.plot: Robert arrives in Elkton, Maryland, to help a community save an old-fashioned lunch counter, located inside a family-owned pharmacy, which has been struggling ever since the original owner's recent death.

6.title: Going Down with the Ship
6.plot: Bad business decisions made by the seemingly clueless owner of "Gigi's Music Café" in Sunshine, Fla., are taking a professional and personal toll.

7.title: The Ambush
7.plot: The owners of "Tornatore's Pizzeria" in Orlando, Florida, are ambushed by Robert and his team.

8.title: Bad Juju
8.plot: Robert deals with a stubborn and inexperienced owner during his makeover of a battered Creole restaurant, in New Orleans, that includes a barbershop, which also needs some sprucing up.

1.title: Ambush: Breakfast Break-In
1.plot: In the Season 12 premiere, Robert leads a surprise makeover ambush of "Theresa's Restaurant" in Bradenton, Florida. Once there, he realizes the owner is her own worst enemy, by being a micro-manager. Also: he faces a kitchen staff mutiny.

2.title: Ambush: Son Sneak Attack
2.plot: The owners of "Lake Arrowhead Sports Grill" in Blue Jay, California, receive a surprise visit from Robert, which was arranged by their son, who's concerned that after five years the business is failing, along with his parents' marriage and his mother's health.

3.title: Ambush: Eyes on the Surprise
3.plot: The owner of a bar and grill in Crestwood, Illinois, which hasn't turned a profit in the eight months it has been open, is also in danger of losing her husband, due to the strain her failing business has put on her marriage.

4.title: Ambush: Stay... Or Go?
4.plot: A historical restaurant in Nashville isn't reaching its potential when Robert Irvine shows up, after being contacted by former employees, and finds the place rundown. While the current staff seem frustrated and unmotivated by the owner's management style.

5.title: Ambush: Fight to the Finish
5.plot: Robert travels to New Kensington, Pennsylvania, to ambush the owner of "Stella's Dine-Inn Restaurant", who, her daughter worries, needs help dealing with the main cook, who also happens to be the owner's son. Also: Robert has design struggles.

6.title: Ambush: Facing Fears
6.plot: Robert Irvine navigates a rollercoaster of emotions in Red Lion, Pennsylvania, as he aims to help the owner of the Cape Horn Family Restaurant face her fears and repair her self-confidence in order to change her staff.

17.title: Ambush: Special Delivery
17.plot: The owner of "La Casa Bianca" in Whitehouse Station, New Jersey, receives a big surprise, chef Robert Irvine shows up at the request of the owner's daughter, who's worried that the business is floundering and that her dad is losing his passion.

1.title: Ambush: Faded Star
1.plot: In the Season 13 premiere, Robert arrives in West Orange, N.J., to help the financially struggling owner of "Starlite Restaurant and Pizza", which hasn't made a profit in nearly 10 years. Problems that need to be addressed are the extremely dirty kitchen.

2.title: Ambush: Beneath the Surface
2.plot: Robert arrives at "De Rican Chef" in Virginia Beach to find the restaurant barely making a profit and the relationship, between the mother and son who operate the business, in poor shape.

3.title: Ambush: A Taxing Situation
3.plot: Robert arrives at the "BFE Bar and Grill" in Waynesboro, Georgia, to find the restaurant deep in debt, with a suspended liquor license for unpaid taxes. Other problems include a poor reputation, painfully slow food service, and a shortage of staff.

4.title: Ambush: In Robert We Trust
4.plot: Robert comes to the aid of the owners of "Peppino's Ristorante Italiano" in Oviedo, Florida, who bought the restaurant in hopes that their son would eventually take over, but they feel they can't trust him because of his poor work ethic and attitude.

5.title: Ambush: Out of Control
5.plot: Chef Robert heads to SiP Bistro in Holly Springs, NC, to try to mend the owners' relationship and negotiate a healthy balance of control. He also must do a full dining room reno and make the small kitchen as efficient as possible.

6.title: Ambush: Exercise Surprise
6.plot: Robert answers a plea for help at So Natural Organic Restaurant and Market in Harker Heights, TX. He must not only teach the owners efficient operating procedures but also help them make great food that happens to be healthy.

7.title: Ambush: Cray, Cray
7.plot: A restaurant concept, inspired by infused liquors from Cambodia, is failing partly because of the owner's lack of experience and dismissive nature. Other problems include a lack of cleanliness, slow food service and some nauseating menu options.

imdb.plot outline: Turning around a failing restaurant is a daunting challenge under the best of circumstances. Attempting to do it in just two days with only $10,000 may be impossible, but that's exactly what Chef Robert Irvine sets out to do in his new Food Network show, Restaurant Impossible. Robert will use a little MacGyver and a lot of muscle to rescue these desperate places from complete collapse. Can one man, in two days, with $10,000, turn the tide of a failing restaurant and give hope to the owners and their employees? Find out as Robert Irvine takes on Restaurant: Impossible.
imdb.title: Restaurant: Impossible
plot: Turning around a failing restaurant is a daunting challenge under the best of circumstances. Attempting to do it in just two days with only $10,000 may be impossible, but that's exactly what Chef Robert Irvine sets out to do in his new Food Network show, Restaurant Impossible. Robert will use a little MacGyver and a lot of muscle to rescue these desperate places from complete collapse. Can one man, in two days, with $10,000, turn the tide of a failing restaurant and give hope to the owners and their employees? Find out as Robert Irvine takes on _Restaurant: Impossible_ (qv).::Anonymous
